comments.body: don't we call that cluster scoped elsewhere?
ic, GroupArgs.RootScopedKinds uses this term as well.
any reason not to do this immediately? Why the if clause?

> any reason not to do this immediately? Why the if clause?

Daniel doc'd it as possibly nil and I don't know what else falls over on nils for it yet.  I think that restmapping is going away from apiregistration, since you don't logically know it at registration time.

I wanted to write 'fully-qualified' or some such, but I don't see any consistency with existing apis.

History.  Mistakes were made early on, but we eventually settled on qualified.  In this repo: `*.k8s.io.`

comments.body: It always looks like a go package, but I do not know why.

> It always looks like a go package, but I do not know why.

There is/was some kind of reflective go-type lookup to build a hard coded RESTMapper.
@deads2k thanks, I'll be on the lookout for that.
